channel.title: Comments on: SQL & NoSQL, The Best of Both Worlds with MySQL Cluster – webinar replay now available
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: John
item.dc:creator: John
item.description:
Hi Andrew, I went to the link for your webinar on the combination sql/no-sql and there was nothing there. How can the MySQL Ram Cluster be used for big data as suggested in your article?
Thanks .. John
item.content:encoded:
Hi Andrew,
I went to the link for your webinar on the combination sql/no-sql and there was nothing there. How can the MySQL Ram Cluster be used for big data as suggested in your article?

Thanks .. John

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/mysql-cluster/sql-nosql-the-best-of-both-worlds-with-mysql-cluster-webinar-replay-now-available#comment-162791">William</a>.
Depends on a number of factors - best to try it out with your data / application. Note that there are signifficant optimisations going into MySQL Cluster 7.4 (get pre-GA version from <a href="http://labs.mysql.com"/ title="MySQL Labs" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MySQL Labs</a>).
Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to William.

Depends on a number of factors – best to try it out with your data / application. Note that there are signifficant optimisations going into MySQL Cluster 7.4 (get pre-GA version from MySQL Labs).

Andrew.

item.title: By: William
item.dc:creator: William
item.description: restore from a power off will take a long time, right?
item.content:encoded: restore from a power off will take a long time, right?
